parallel

Class BoundedMinHeapUnsynchronized

  • java.lang.Object
    • parallel.BoundedMinHeapUnsynchronized

  • public class BoundedMinHeapUnsynchronized
extends java.lang.Object
    a bounded-length Min-Heap data structure, supporting insert/remove-min/ decrease-key operations in O(logN) time. All methods are unsynchronized for efficiency reasons. The implementation uses standard array-based complete binary tree. For more information see ch. 6 in: "M.A. Weiss, Data Structures and Algorithm Analysis in C++, Addison-Wesley, Upper Saddle River, NJ, 2014". This class is used in shortest-path computing in the graph.Graph class.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2017

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

      auxiliary static inner-class used as default comparator for heap.

    • Method Detail

      • size

        public int size()
        returns the current number of objects held in this min-heap. Obviously O(1) operation.
        Returns:
        int

      • getMaxSize

        public int getMaxSize()
        return the capacity of this min-heap. Obviously, O(1) operation.
        Returns:
        int

      • reset

        public void reset()
        resets this heap, letting the comparator as is.

      • addElement

        public void addElement(java.lang.Object o)
        adds an element to this heap. Duplicates are not allowed. Time complexity is O(logN) where N is the size of this heap (assuming O(1) complexity for hash-map operations containsKey(),put()).
        Parameters:
        o - Object must be comparable via this object's comparator member (_comp)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if min-heap is full
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if o already exists in min-heap

      • remove

        public java.lang.Object remove()
        remove the min-element from this heap. Time complexity is O(logN) where N is the size of this heap.
        Returns:
        Object the min-element in this heap
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if min-heap is empty

      • decreaseKey

        public void decreaseKey(java.lang.Object key,
                        java.lang.Object update)
        find the object key in the min-heap, and move it up so that its position matches the position for the value of the update object. Time complexity is O(logN) where N is the size of this heap, assuming O(1) complexity for hash-map operations remove(),get(),put().
        Parameters:
        key - Object the object to be updated in this min-heap
        update - Object the updated object that replaces the key above
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if key doesn't exist in the min-heap

      • iterator

        public java.util.Iterator iterator()
        provides an iterator interface to this min-heap. Construction of this iterator is quite expensive (O(N) where N is the number of objects in the min-heap.)
        Returns:
        java.util.Iterator

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        return a String representation of the elements in this min-heap.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String

      • findPos

        private int findPos(java.lang.Object key)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        find the index in the store where key is stored.
        Parameters:
        key - Object
        Returns:
        int the index where key is stored (in the range [1,_curSize]).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if key is not found.

        private void percolateDown(int hole)
